title: British coalition conducts airstrike on Yemen port city : Houthi TV | Central India Premier English Daily
message:
Sanaa, Aug 16 (UNI) The U.S.-British coalition conducted an airstrike on Yemen’s Red Sea port city of Hodeidah on Thursday evening, according to Houthi-run al-Masirah TV.
The strike reportedly targeted the northwestern al-Salif district, but details on casualties were not immediately available.
Residents on social media reported a significant explosion near a Houthi-controlled site.
The Houthis control much of northern Yemen, including parts of the Red Sea coast.
Since November, the Houthis have targeted Israeli-linked ships, citing “solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.” In response, the U.S.-British naval coalition has carried out regular air raids and missile strikes against Houthi positions since January, with limited success.
event_breakdown: Sanaa, Aug 16 (UNI) The U.S.-British coalition conducted an airstrike on Yemen’s Red Sea port city of Hodeidah on Thursday evening, according to Houthi-run al-Masirah TV. Target: Houthi controlled site, the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah. The strike reportedly targeted the northwestern al-Salif district, but details on casualties were not immediately available.

title: Deadly suicide attack in southern Yemen kills 14 soldiers
message:
Aden : , Aug 16 (IANS) A suicide bomber suspected to be affiliated with Yemen-based al-Qaeda branch killed at least 14 soldiers in the country's turbulent southern province of Abyan on Friday morning, a security official told Xinhua news agency.
The explosion caused significant casualties, with initial medical reports indicating that at least 14 soldiers lost their lives in the attack.
The local Yemeni security official said the death toll may rise as medical teams continue to treat the severely wounded soldiers.
The Yemen-based branch of al-Qaeda has not yet claimed responsibility for the attack.
The incident marked the latest in a series of violent attacks against the STC forces and pro-government forces in Yemen which has been embroiled in a civil war since 2014.
event_breakdown:
Target Event:
A suicide bomber suspected to be affiliated with Yemen-based al-Qaeda branch killed at least 14 soldiers in the country's turbulent southern province of Abyan on Friday morning.

According to them, the Islamic Republic has been debating whether to launch a massive attack on Israel or whether to carry out "a covert intelligence operation," the US television channel said.
The Israel Defense Forces then said that it had deflected the strike.
British, US and French troops stationed in the Middle East helped Israel in downing Iranian projectiles.
British and French officials also told CBS that their militaries will be ready "to defend Israel, and we remain in constant touch with the US and allies on potential scenarios."

title: Dozens of Israeli settlers attack West Bank village
message:
Dozens of Israeli settlers surged into a Palestinian village in the West Bank yesterday, burning cars and killing at least one person, Israeli authorities admitted yesterday.
Shocking footage circulated on social media showed houses and cars smouldering after being set alight by Molotov cocktails thrown by the Israeli settlers.
The fatal attacks came hours after an Israeli airstrike in the West Bank killed two other young Palestinians.
More than 600 Palestinians in the West Bank have been killed since October 7, most of whom died as a result of incursions by Israeli settlers.
The White House, whose diplomats are now engaged in a fresh round of ceasefire talks with international mediators, declared Israeli settlers' attacks in the West Bank 'unacceptable' and insisted they 'must stop.'

title: FBI responds to congressman saying body of Trump shooter is  gone
message:
The FBI is pushing back after a Republican's startling discovery that Donald Trump shooter Thomas Matthew Crooks' body had been quietly cremated.
Rep. Clay Higgins, R-La., a member of Congress' bipartisan task force reviewing the tragic July 13 assassination attempt, unveiled that Crooks' body is 'gone' in an independent report released this week.
The FBI released his body to the family just 10 days after the attack.
In it he questions why Crooks' body was released to the family by the FBI without any oversight.
'Why, then, by what measure, would the FBI release his body to the family for cremation?
event_breakdown:
Title: Republican Congressman Questions FBI's Decision to Release Trump Shooter's Body for Cremation

Description: U.S. Representative Clay Higgins (R-La.) raised questions about the release of Thomas Matthew Crooks' body by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) to his family for cremation. Crooks is the man who attempted to assassinate former President Donald Trump at the Trump National Golf Club in suburban Washington, D.C. on July 13, 2017.

Additional Information:

* Clay Higgins, a Republican representing Louisiana's 3rd congressional district, has written a report that questions the FBI's decision to release Thomas Matthew Crooks' body to his family for cremation.
* Higgins serves as a member of a bipartisan task force reviewing the tragic assassination attempt that occurred in 2017.
* In the independent report released this week, Higgins expressed concerns about the lack of a process to verify the identity of Crooks and said he was "deeply disturbed" by using an unknown cremation facility to handle the remains of fugitives.
* It is unclear why Crooks' body was released to the family by the FBI without any oversight.

title: Russian attack on Sumy Oblast kills 1 , injures 3
message:
Russian forces attacked 11 communities in Sumy Oblast on Aug. 15, killing one and injuring three people, the Sumy Oblast Military Administration reported.
The security situation in Sumy Oblast became more tense with the start of Ukraine's cross-border incursion into neighboring Kursk Oblast in Russia, which began on Aug. 6.
Sumy Oblast borders Russia's Bryansk, Kursk, and Belgorod oblasts.
Civilians in Sumy Oblast within 20 kilometers (12 miles) of the border with Kursk Oblast are now subject to restrictions on movement due to increasing Russian attacks, according to the General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces.

title: Russian defense plan kicks off separate AI development push
message:
MOSCOW — Russian officials have unveiled a new 10-year defense plan that includes a dedicated section on artificial intelligence, signaling Moscow’s focus on fielding autonomous weapons.
Elements of artificial intelligence have long been used in the Russian military industry, which is tightly controlled by the government.
A specialized department for the development of artificial intelligence is now in place in the Russian Defense Ministry, Chernyshenko announced.
“The Russian defense industry will develop artificial intelligence and automated systems for products with high speed, where errors are not so critical,” said Sergei Smyslov, an independent defense industry expert based in Russia.
With that in mind, potential applications include missile defense systems, artillery shells and aerial drones, he added.

title: Russia says repelled 12 missiles targeting Crimea bridge
message:
MOSCOW (AFP): Russia said Friday that it had repelled a night-time attack using 12 US-made missiles on the landmark Crimea bridge built on the orders of President Vladimir Putin after Moscow annexed the peninsula.
“Air defenses were used last night to deflect a group strike by 12 ATACMS missiles made in the US on the Crimean bridge.
All the missiles were destroyed,” the defense ministry said in a statement.
Kyiv has launched multiple attacks and attempted attacks on the Kerch Bridge since Moscow began its military offensive in February 2022.
Russia’s defense ministry said earlier Friday that helicopters had destroyed five naval drones in the Black Sea heading for Crimea.

title: Irish police investigating whether stabbing of army chaplain terror - related
message:
Irish police investigating whether stabbing of army chaplain terror-related1 minuteDUBLIN (Reuters) – Irish police are investigating whether the stabbing of a chaplain at an army barracks in the western city of Galway late on Thursday had a terrorism motive, police said on Friday.
The victim in his 50s received a number of stab wounds and was taken to hospital for treatment on serious but not life-threatening injuries, police said.
A male teen was restrained by members of the defence forces and arrested at the scene.
“One line of enquiry is to establish if this attack had a terrorism motivation,” police said in a statement.
“An Garda Siochana (police) wishes to reassure the public that at this time it is not believed this incident is part of a wider conspiracy.”The priest, Father Paul Murphy, said on a post on his Facebook page on Friday that he was “doing okay” and awaiting surgery.
event_breakdown: Security forces have detained a male teenager following the stabbing of an army chaplain in Ireland. The chaplain received serious but not life threatening injuries when attacked at an army barracks in Galway. Although it is not believed the incident is part of a wider conspiracy, police are investigating whether it may have had a terrorism motive as security agencies conduct inquiries.

Antonov said that there was no way that Ukraine would attack Nord Stream without “the wink” from Washington.

title: Palestinian death toll in Gaza exceeds 40 , 000 as peace talks renew
message:
Palestinian death toll in Gaza exceeds 40,000 as peace talks renewXinhua) 08:09, August 16, 2024People mourn victims killed in an Israeli airstrike in the southern Gaza Strip city of Khan Younis, on Aug. 14, 2024.
(Photo by Rizek Abdeljawad/Xinhua)GAZA, Aug. 15 (Xinhua) -- The Palestinian death toll from the ongoing Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip has surpassed 40,000 as of Thursday, at a time when the Gaza ceasefire talks were set to resume in Qatar.
It took only five and a half months for the Palestinian death toll in the Gaza Strip to rise from 30,000 to 40,000.
A man stands among the rubble after an Israeli airstrike in the Nuseirat refugee camp, central Gaza Strip, on Aug. 12, 2024.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement on Thursday that it is continuing operational activity in the Gaza Strip, "eliminating terrorists and dismantling terrorist infrastructure."
event_breakdown: Target event "Palestinian death toll in Gaza exceeds 40,000 as peace talks renew"

title: Soldiers work with Marines as the Corps ramps up its air defenses
message:
For the first time, Marines with Marine Air Support Squadron 3, Marine Air Control Group 38, out of the 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing at Camp Pendleton, California, hosted the Army’s air defense artillery fire control officer course, according to a release.
The Army is adding hundreds of new air defense specialties in the coming years, Army Times previously reported.
Gabriel Smith, an air defense officer with Marine Air Support Squadron 3.
Marines and soldiers pose during the air defense artillery fire control officer course at Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton, California, July 25, 2024.
“The importance of this training to the joint force and to the Marine Corps cannot be overstated,” said Lt. Col. Tyrone Anub Jr., MASS-3 commanding officer.

title: Al - Qassam releases Kamikaze drone attack on Israeli forces
message:
ALBAWABA - The armed branch of Hamas, the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades, today released a video showing an attack on an Israeli-occupied building east of Khan Yunis in the southern Gaza Strip.
The video, which was taken on Thursday, shows how a camera-equipped kamikaze drone was deployed to attack the structure.
A ground force member from Al-Qassam made the following statement before to the attack: "By God's will, this kamikaze drone will deliver a swift and deadly blow, with His guidance and support."
Similar footage of "Al-Zawari" kamikaze drones being launched on Israeli military positions near the Gaza border and in the surrounding areas has already been made public by Al-Qassam.
Videos showing the militants' attempts to repel the Israeli military's massive ground assault of Gaza have been regularly released by Al-Qassam since the invasion began in late October.
event_breakdown:
Current event of security from Albawaba:
Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades, the armed wing of Hamas, launched a kamikaze drone attack on an occupied building east of Khan Yunis, Gaza Strip, on Thursday.

title: Ceasefire talks resume in Qatar as violence surges in Gaza
message:
Ceasefire talks resume in Qatar as violence surges in GazaDOHANegotiators seeking a Gaza ceasefire were scheduled to meet for a second day in Qatar on Friday, while top European diplomats were expected in Israel to stress the urgency of averting a wider war amid rising violence in Gaza.
Israel's main military supplier, the United States, has been mediating the talks with Qatar and Egypt.
The United States and its allies see the proposed Gaza truce as key to de-escalating soaring regional tensions, particularly with Iran.
The Gaza war has also drawn in Tehran-aligned groups in Iraq, Syria, and Yemen.
The Qatari foreign ministry said Gaza truce negotiations would continue on Friday.
event_breakdown: Ceasefire talks resume in Qatar as violence surges in Gaza. Top European diplomats are expected in Israel to stress the urgency of averting a wider war amid rising violence in Gaza.

title: Court of Appeals reverses conviction for former Lexington High School student found guilty in 2014 deadly stabbing
message:
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) - The South Carolina Court of Appeals reversed the conviction of a man who was found guilty in the deadly stabbing of a Dutch Fork High School student.
“A mistrial is the equivalent of no trial and leaves the cause pending in the circuit court,” the South Carolina Court of Appeals said in court documents.
In reversing his conviction, the South Carolina Court of Appeals ordered the trial court to give Dennis a new immunity hearing.
Ultimately, the South Carolina Court of Appeals found the proper course was to remand for a new immunity hearing.
“The circuit court is in the best position to assess witness credibility and make the necessary findings of fact,” said the South Carolina Court of Appeals in the court documents.

title: Suspect arrested after convenience store employee stabbed
message:
SAN DIEGO (FOX 5/KUSI) — A man was arrested Thursday after a stabbing at a convenience store in downtown San Diego, authorities said.
The stabbing occurred around 1 p.m. at an A-Mart located at 1255 Imperial Avenue, the San Diego Police Department said in a news release.
While store employees were removing the suspect from the store due to him being intoxicated and causing a disturbance, the suspect pulled out a knife and lunged at one of the employees, according to police.
Transit security initially detained the suspect, identified as 36-year-old Juan Flores-Puga, who was then arrested by SDPD.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to FOX 5 San Diego & KUSI News.

title: Ukraine swift push into the Kursk region shocked Russia and exposed its vulnerabilities
message:
In more than a week of fighting, Russian troops are still struggling to drive out the invaders.
That includes a 245-kilometer (152-mile) section in the Kursk region.
Ukrainian troops faced no such obstacles entering the Kursk region.

Israeli Minister of Foreign Affairs Israel Katz met on Friday with French Foreign Minister Stéphane Séjourné and British Foreign Secretary David Lammy who arrived in Israel to prevent a regional escalation and to promote a hostage deal.
Katz made clear to his French and British counterparts that Israel expects France and the UK to publicly inform Iran that it may not attack Israel and that if Iran attacks, the US-led coalition will join Israel, not only in defense but in offense against significant targets in Iran as well.

title: US Destroys Houthi Ground Control Station | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | David Israel | 12 Av 5784 – Friday , August 16 , 2024
message:
Photo Credit: Petty Officer 2nd Class Aaron Lau, US Naval Forces Central CommandIn the past 24 hours, US Central Command (USCENTCOM) forces successfully destroyed an Iranian-backed Houthi ground control station in a Houthi-controlled area of Yemen.
According to CENTCOM’s statement, “It was determined this ground control station presented a clear and imminent threat to US and coalition forces, and merchant vessels in the region.
On August 9, USCENTCOM forces successfully destroyed an Iranian-backed Houthi missile launcher and one uncrewed surface vessel in Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen.
Additionally, USCENTCOM forces successfully destroyed two Houthi unmanned aerial vehicles over the Red Sea.
“These weapons presented a clear and imminent threat to US and coalition forces, and merchant vessels in the region.

title: UPDATE 1 - Israeli army orders fresh evacuations in Gaza as fighting continues
message:
The Israeli army ordered people in south and central Gaza areas it had previously designated humanitarian safe zones to leave on Friday, saying Hamas had used the areas to fire mortars and rockets at Israel.
Any sustained assault on Deir al-Balah could push tens of thousands of people to flee again to other parts of the already devastated Palestinian enclave.
Even in areas designated safe zones there have been regular reports of casualties from Israeli strikes.
Israel accuses Hamas and other militant groups of deliberately basing fighters in civilian areas, a charge Hamas denies.
The assault on Gaza has killed more than 40,000 Palestinians, mostly civilians, according to Palestinian health authorities.

I promise you: if Iran attacks Israel, Britain will stand by it as it did on April 14."
He warned Tehran that it would pay a heavy price both strategically and economically for any attack against Israel.
"We just visited Lebanon and can tell that the Lebanese do not want war, and war is not in Hezbollah's interest.

message:

title: Greenville man dies after stabbing during late - night altercation
message:
The Greenville Police Department is investigating a fatal stabbing that happened on Monday night, August 12, 2024.
According to officials, GPD responded to 113 Toby Circle around 2 a.m. in reference to a male who had been stabbed.
Upon arrival, authorities located Dwayne William Young Jr., 30, of Greenville, in a parking lot suffering from a stab wound.
Officials say that during the investigation, it was discovered that Young and another male on the scene were in a physical altercation when the stabbing occurred.
The investigation remains active and the case is being reviewed to determine if any charges will be filed.

title: Attack on a city in Sudan kills at least five and injures more : UNICEF
message:
Attack on a city in Sudan kills at least five and injures more: UNICEF15 August 2024 - Bombing which devastated a school and market in the Sudanese city of El Obeid on Wednesday has left five girls dead and 20 children injured according to the UN Children's Fund's Sudan Representative.
This attack followed another on Sunday where a "shell struck a UNICEF-supported child-friendly space in Al Hattana, Khartoum state, killing two boys and injuring at least 8 eight others," said Mr. Yett.
The attacks "come in wake of" other strikes against health facilities in other regions of the country, he added.
"Attacks on schools represent a grave violation against children," Mr. Yett said.
These attacks have killed and injured thousands of children, Mr. Yett said.

title: Gaza ceasefire negotiations extend another day as death toll exceeds 40 , 000
message:
– Negotiators were to meet in the Qatari capital Doha again on Friday in an effort to hammer out a Gaza ceasefire agreement as Israel continued to slam targets in the Palestinian enclave.
Gaza health officials reported separately on Thursday that the death toll there had surpassed 40,000 people after more than 10 months of fighting.
This round of negotiations opened on Thursday, and the talks would resume on Friday for a second day, Qatari and US officials said.
Gaza health officials said at least six Palestinians were killed on Thursday night in an Israeli air strike on a house in Jabalia in northern Gaza Strip.

title: Aroostook County explosion caused by disconnected propane line
message:
An explosion that destroyed two homes in Aroostook County on Saturday was caused by a disconnected propane line, officials said Thursday.
The Office of State Fire Marshal concluded that the explosion at 441 Shore Road in Sinclair was an accident.
The propane line had been disconnected from a heating unit that had been mistakenly turned on, triggering the explosion, Shannon Moss, spokesperson for the Department of Public Safety said in a statement.
Both homes were labeled complete losses after the explosion.
His neighbor escaped the house uninjured, Moss said.
event_breakdown: Office of State Fire Marshal concluded that the explosion at 441 Shore Road in Sinclair was an accident. The propane line had been disconnected from a heating unit that had been mistakenly turned on, triggering the explosion. Both homes were labeled complete losses after the explosion.

title: Sacramento man arrested after an explosion in Merced
message:
FRESNO, Calif. (KSEE/KGPE) – A 24-year-old Sacramento man was arrested after an explosion in Merced, according to the Merced Police Department.
Police say on August 11, around 1:30 a.m. officers responded to a report of an explosion in the 700 block of Sunol Court.
Officers say they could not locate the explosion’s source at the time, but investigators were able to find video of the incident and locate the initial explosion.
Using the video, officers say they were able to locate a home where the person had fled following the blast.
On August 16, Merced Police officers with the assistance of the Sacramento County Sheriff’s Office served a search and arrest warrant on Tindle’s home in Sacramento.
event_breakdown: Security event: Explosion in Merced, CA - On August 16, Merced Police officers arrested a 24-year-old Sacramento man after an explosion in the 700 block of Sunol Court in Merced, CA. Investigators were able to locate the initial explosion and the video of the incident which helped officers locate the person's home where the explosion had occurred.

title: Bengal : Scattered response to strike called by SUCI - C on RG Kar issue
message:
At the Diamond Harbour section in the South Division of Sealdah, train services were disrupted following rail-blockade agitation by the SUCI-C activists at a number of stations.
The worst affected stations were Diamond Harbour and Lakshmikantapur, with the latter being a traditional stronghold pocket of SUCI-C for years.
Major tension was reported on Friday morning from Cooch Behar district following scuffles between the police personnel and the strikers.
At the SUCI-C activists went for road blockades there, and the huge police contingent present there tried to disperse them, which led to clashes.
At Kolkata, tensions broke out at Hazra's four-point crossing in South Kolkata, which is barely a kilometre away from the residence of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at Kalighat.

title: Ukraine gains in Russian territory are Putin worst nightmare
message:
Ukraine’s recent military gains in Russian territory mark a significant shift in the ongoing conflict.
Now, for the first time in the 21st century, an invading military power, Ukraine, is in possession of hundreds of square miles of Russian territory, capturing Russian military prisoners and forcing a state of emergency and evacuations in the Belgorod and Kursk regions.
But their bold move has changed perceptions of Ukraine’s military competence.
Even that will be difficult against a determined Russian military response, which is sure to come.
But the picture of Russian jets bombing Russian villages to drive out Ukrainian soldiers is surely a compelling one for Kyiv.

title: The Underwater Pipelines That Supplied Fuel For The Allied Invasion Of Normandy
message:
But how successful was Operation PLUTO in helping to supply the necessary fuel for the Allies?
This pipeline network, known as the Government Pipeline Storage System (GPSS) pipeline, formed the backbone of the PLUTO pipelines.
Copyright © IWMPetrol pipe for Operation PLUTO being wound onto a ‘conundrum’ pipe-laying device, June 1944.
Work on the PLUTO pipeline relied on the Allies capturing Cherbourg harbor intact in only eight days.
In May 1945, Churchill himself suggested that Operation PLUTO was “a wholly British achievement and a piece of amphibious engineering skill of which we may well be proud.”Ultimately, Operation PLUTO was less successful than the British authorities envisioned in 1942 and 1943.
event_breakdown:
Operation PLUTO
The Operation PLUTO pipeline network took its name from the acronym of the Petroleum (Liquid Transfer) Operation, established by the Allies during World War II for pumping fuel to advancing troops. Although less successful than envisioned, Operation PLUTO was a successful endeavor to end supply chain bottlenecks and deliver petroleum products to where they were most needed.

Cherbourg
Work on the PLUTO pipeline relied on the Allies capturing the strategically important Cherbourg harbor intact in 1944. Now a major underwater archeology site, Cherbourg harbor played a key role in the success of the PLUTO pipeline.
Maritime Security
The maritime security threat posed by an enemy attack on Cherbourg during the PLUTO pipeline’s work was a major concern for the Allies.

title: Wagner Group and the IRGC : The Rise of Self - Sustaining Military Proxies
message:

The Wagner Group is a private military company, owned by one man—Yevgeny Prigozhin.
Just as the IRGC’s operations have spread from Iran to Syria and beyond, so have Wagner Group operations extended from Ukraine through much of Africa.
A private military company is not the same as a state-run military, but there is nothing inherently unique about the Wagner Group that separates its activities from those of Iran’s IRGC.

title: Mastering Threats Beneath Waves

To help counteract this threat, two Royal Australian Navy sailors recently participated in the Royal Navy's advanced mine warfare course at HMS Collingwood in England.
Warrant Officer Lockard and Chief Petty Officer Cochrane learned planning considerations, including how to identify areas likely to be mined, best patterns of search to identify targets and best available disposal methods.
"The course is designed for us to conduct practical planning for the execution of mine warfare operations," Warrant Officer Lockard said.
Both sailors are now qualified to work as mine warfare planners within maritime task groups.
"I am looking forward to using my new knowledge and skills to overcome challenges with mine countermeasures operations," Chief Petty Officer Cochrane said.

BEIRUT: Hezbollah, the Lebanese group, published footage on Friday that appeared to show its fighters driving trucks with rocket launchers through a maze of tunnels to an apparent underground launch site.
The footage, four minutes and 35 seconds long, is the latest in a series of videos by the group showing its purported military capabilities.
The newest video depicts fighters riding motorcycles, working on laptops and driving around a dozen trucks through the rocky tunnels.
The video identified the facility as being named “Imad 4”, an apparent reference to Imad Mughniyeh, a shadowy Hezbollah commander killed in 2008.
Shortly after Hezbollah published its video, the Iranian embassy in Beirut said Iran had its own underground missile stations that could strike Israel.

title: Drug - crazed son who stabbed his mother to death in front of shocked paramedics discovers his fate
message:
A web developer has been found guilty of murder after stabbing his own mother to death in front of paramedics while affected by a cocktail of drugs.
The court heard how Ms Cameron, a 63-year-old nurse, had called paramedics in the early hours of the morning concerned her son had overdosed.
Ambulance officers arrived and found Ms Cameron helping him drink water in his bed and he became agitated when they attempted to take him to hospital.
However, when Ms Cameron further pressed him to go with the ambulance officers he went to the kitchen where he retrieved a knife and she followed him.
He was taken to hospital in an ambulance in which he repeatedly asked paramedics if his mother was going to be alright.

Protesters in Kazakhstan continue despite the government announcing a state of emergency on Wednesday.

In Almaty, the largest city in the country, protesters set fire to the city hall and police headquarters after being met with violence. Police have reportedly used tear gas and stun grenades to disperse crowds.

Russia has sent in troops at the request of the Kazakh government, a move that has been criticized by some who see it as interference in the affairs of a sovereign state.

2. Target event: Fire at Russian defence ministry

A massive fire broke out at a defence ministry building in the Russian capital Moscow on Sunday morning.

Videos posted on social media showed flames and plumes of black smoke coming from the building, which is located on the city's outskirts.

Around 150 fire fighters and 50 pieces of equipment were deployed to battle the blaze, which was brought under control by the afternoon. No injuries were reported.

The cause of the fire is under investigation.

title: NATO steps up naval presence in Western Pacific to counter China
message:
NATO is bolstering its presence in the Western Pacific by sending warships to more places, a move that risks stoking tensions with China, which is worried about the alliance’s growing influence in the region.
The latest entrant is the Italian aircraft carrier Cavour, the first time Rome has deployed its lone carrier to the Pacific.
The Cavour and an Italian frigate recently held exercises with the U.S. carrier USS Abraham Lincoln near the island of Guam.
A day later, F-35 stealth jets and AV-8B Harriers launched from the Cavour practiced shooting down airborne targets.
"This is a demonstration, above all, of our ability to project power anywhere,” said Rear Adm. Giancarlo Ciappina, the commander of the Cavour carrier strike group.

Kazuko Ikegame writes names in the list of deceased atomic bomb victims on July 24 in Hiroshima.
This year marked the 79th anniversary of the atomic explosion that leveled Hiroshima on Aug. 6, 1945.
Of that number, she wrote about 100,000 names, one by one, over the years.
This year’s list, which she completed on the evening of Aug. 5, the day before the ceremony, while she was fighting cancer, was her 35th.
On Aug. 15, she received a letter of appreciation from the city of Hiroshima for her achievement.
event_breakdown:
Target event:
The city of Hiroshima sent a letter of appreciation to Kazuko Ikegame on Aug 15 for her achievement in recording the names of the deceased atomic bomb victims.

title: Japan to survey Alaskan island in hopes of recovering WWII dead
message:
Some 2,600 Japanese soldiers died on Attu Island in May 1943, according to the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare, in a doomed attempt to hold the northern Pacific island, captured in June 1942, from over 10,000 U.S. personnel.
Remains of around 320 soldiers were recovered in 1953, but later inspections in 2007 and 2008 did not culminate in the collection of any remains.
The United States will provide a boat for the upcoming five-day survey that will include the inspection of roads and runways and confirmation of the location of remains of the Japanese war dead.
During the trip next week, the participants plan to also visit a U.S. military base in Alaska and offer prayers at a cenotaph to Japanese soldiers.
Yamazaki's grandfather, Yasuyo Yamazaki, commanded the Japanese forces on Attu Island and led the men to their death under orders from the headquarters.

Relevant text:
Remains of around 320 soldiers were recovered in 1953, but later inspections in 2007 and 2008 did not culminate in the collection of any remains. The U.S. will provide a boat for an upcoming five-day survey.

title: Book review : New eyes on an old battle
message:
“Voices From Gettysburg: Letters, Papers, and Memoirs From the Greatest Battle of the Civil War” by Allen C. Guelzo, Citadel Press, 352 pages, $29.
Allen C. Guelzo’s bestselling 2013 book, “Gettysburg: The Last Invasion,” is the favorite of three weighty tomes on this battle which occupy this reviewer’s shelf of literature on the American Civil War.
The author’s recent book, “Voices From Gettysburg,” serves as a worthy coda for that excellent book and provides a window into how future historians may shape the public’s perception of any cataclysmic event.
This book is composed of eyewitness descriptions of the prelude, details and aftermath of the battle, which was crucial to deciding the war’s outcome.
The material provided includes letters, memoirs and official records from both military and civilian survivors of the bloody confrontation.
event_breakdown: A series of letters, reports, and memoirs about the days leading up to, happenings of, and aftermath of the Battle of Gettysburg during the Civil War in the United States

event_breakdown: Security event: On February 3, 2023, a bombing took place on a crowded street in the center of the city of Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 30 people were killed and more than 70 wounded in the attack, which took place during the busy morning rush hour. The Taliban government has accused the Islamic State (IS) group for the attack. It is reported that the attack was carried out by a lone suicide bomber who detonated his explosive vest among the crowd. The target of the bombing is believed to be the Shia Hazara minority, who are historically marginalized in Afghanistan and are often targeted by IS and other militant groups. According to security experts, the attack highlights the continued security challenges faced by the Taliban government, despite promises of public safety. The attack also highlights the difficulty faced by Islamic State militias to destroy the new government and reverse the changes that have come to Afghanistan. While security personnel in Afghanistan are doing everything possible to prevent other such attacks, the conflict has led to increased violence, displacement, and economic devastation across the country.

title: The Kursk attack has humiliated Putin – and changed the narrative over how the war is fought | Orysia Lutsevych
message:
First, at the very start of the war in 2022, its forces repelled a Russian assault on the capital, Kyiv.
Now, their tanks are rolling in to Russian territory.
Kyiv’s territorial gains, in contrast to the size of Russia’s territory, are, of course, small.
Now, with Kursk, there are enemy forces occupying Russian territory for the first time since the second world war.
Kursk also dispels the narrative that this war should only be fought on Ukrainian soil, and that, somehow, Ukraine could prevail by attacking Russian positions only inside its own borders.

title: Ukraine Destroys Key Bridge In Kursk Region Using US - Supplied HIMARS
message:
Regardless of which side's narrative of events are more accurate amid the fog of war, the biggest end of week development has involved the destruction of a key Russian bridge on Friday.
"Later on Friday, the bridge collapsed after being struck by a U.S.-supplied HIMARS rocket, the Kremlin-aligned Mash Telegram news channel reported, publishing images of the destroyed structure," the report continued.
Aerial images and videos have been circulating throughout the day, and Acting Kursk region governor Alexei Smirnov has since confirmed that the bridge collapsed.
The Seym River bridge, via MashThe specific targeting of the bridge may be a move by Ukraine to solidify control of the Glushkovsky district, which leaves the protection of the Seym River a significant geographical barrier for Russian troops.
Ukraine's air force boasted that it took out the bridge...Ukraine’s Air Force Commander Lieutenant General Mykola Oleschuk claims responsibility for the destruction of a bridge in Russia’s Kursk region today.
event_breakdown: Ukraine's Air Force claims responsibility for the destruction of a bridge in Russia's Kursk region on June 17, 2022.

title: Defence spending conundrum
message:
Quite how the government will continue to invest in defence and security needs under the Defence White Paper (DWP) published in 2019 without any actual figure being stated is interesting, although there is acknowledgement that defence spending is long-term and lasts beyond the allocations of a five-year Malaysia Plan (MP).
What the DWP really reveals is the government’s commitment to trimming the national debt, which will have to be balanced with defence spending aims that are long-term and stable, as well as affordable and sustainable.
Military spending under Budget 2024 is approximately 1% of GDP compared to 0.98% of GDP under Budget 2023.
CAP-55 envisions two multirole combat aircraft squadrons and three light combat aircraft squadrons, with defence analysts estimating that a total of around 100 aircraft will comprise these squadrons.
This is the ideal and is unlikely given the historic military spending and the country’s current economic prospects.
event_breakdown:
The Defence White Paper (DWP), published in 2019, acknowledges the need to invest in defence and security needs without providing specific figures. It highlights the government’s commitment to trimming the national debt and balancing that with sustainable defence spending goals.

Budget 2024 allocates approximately 1% of GDP to military spending, compared to 0.98% of GDP under Budget 2023.

CAP-55, a military modernisation programme, envisions the formation of two multirole combat aircraft squadrons and three light combat aircraft squadrons. This would require an estimated total of 100 aircraft.

Nonetheless, it remains unclear how the government plans to achieve this given the country’s historic military spending and economic prospects.

title: Church of Jesus Christ makes donation to combat child malnutrition in rural Mexico
message:
Estimated read time: 1-2 minutesSALT LAKE CITY — The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and the nonprofit Un Kilo de Ayuda are working together on a project to combat child malnutrition in rural Mexican communities.
Un Kilo de Ayuda will deliver nutritional packages geared to children under the age of 5 because of a donation from the Church of Jesus Christ, according to a release.
More than 43,000 people, including 23,000 children and 20,000 mothers or caregivers, will benefit from the donation.
The donation to Un Kilo de Ayuda also includes equipment that can be used to detect anemia.
This is another instance of the Relief Society of the Church of Jesus Christ's initiative to combat child malnutrition and improve access to nutrition and educational materials for both women and children around the world.
event_breakdown:
Location: Mexico
Event: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and Un Kilo de Ayuda are working together on a project to combat child malnutrition in rural Mexican communities.

title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills 10 , injures 5 , state news agency says
message:
Photo: AFP FilePublished: Sat 17 Aug 2024, 4:39 PMAround 10 people were killed, including two children, and five were wounded by an Israeli airstrike on a residential building in the city of Nabatieh in south Lebanon, state news agency NNA said on Saturday.
The Israeli strike came after ceasefire talks between Hamas and Israel in Doha paused on Friday with negotiators due to meet again next week.
Hezbollah later said in a statement that it had struck the Ayelet Hashahar Kibbutz in northern Israel in retaliation for the Nabatieh strike.
Two soldiers were wounded in a rocket attack from Lebanon, the Israeli military said, adding that a total of 55 rockets had been fired in latest strikes from Lebanon.
Also on Saturday, an Israeli drone targeted a motorcycle in the Qadmous area east of Tyre in south Lebanon, NNA reported, adding that one person was injured.

title: Gaza rescuers say Israeli strike kills 15 from same family
message:
Gaza's civil defence agency said an Israeli air strike in the early hours of Saturday(August 17, 2024) killed 15 people from a Palestinian family, including nine children and three women.
The strike hit the home of the Ajlah family in Al-Zawaida neighbourhood of central Gaza, said civil defence spokesman Mahmud Bassal.
The Israeli military did not offer an immediate comment.
"The toll from the Israeli strike on the Ajlah family home and their warehouse in Al-Zawaida is 15 dead," Mr. Bassal said.
Militants also seized 251 people during the attack, 111 of whom are still held captive in Gaza, including 39 the Israeli military says are dead.
event_breakdown: Gaza's civil defence agency says in the early hours of Saturday, an Israeli airstrike killed 15 people from a Palestinian family. The strike hit the home of the Ajlah family in the al-Zawaida neighborhood of central Gaza. Israel did not offer an immediate comment. Those killed included nine children and 3 women, according to the agency.

title: Deadly violence persists in Gaza despite mediator hopes for a truce
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — As mediators expressed optimism for an imminent cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas, violence raged on Saturday in the Gaza Strip, where an Israeli airstrike killed at least 18 people, all from the same family.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
The Israeli military, which rarely comments on individual strikes, said it was checking the report.
It said Saturday it was continuing attacks on militants in central Gaza, including one seen launching rockets at troops.
In a post on X, Israeli military spokesperson Avichay Adraee said Palestinians in areas in and around the urban Maghazi refugee camp should leave.

Map events: Gaza
Event one: Israeli military killed 18 people in Gaza
Event two: Sami Jawad al-Ejlah was killed by Israel
Event three: Israeli military attacks militants in central Gaza

title: Israeli strike kills at least 10 in southern Lebanon in one of the deadliest incidents since October 7
message:
CNN —An Israeli strike has killed at least ten people in Nabatiyeh, southern Lebanon, the Lebanese Ministry of Health said, prompting Hezbollah to launch a barrage of retaliatory rockets at Israel.
The Israeli military said it struck a Hezbollah weapons storage facility in the area of Nabatieh overnight.
The death toll from the strike is one of the largest in southern Lebanon since Israel launched its war on Gaza following the Hamas attacks of October 7 that killed around 1,200 people.
Iran-backed Hezbollah militants in Lebanon launched a volley of rockets towards Ayelet Hashahar in northern Israel in response to the strike, the group said in a statement.
Tensions between Lebanon and Israel deepened further late last month when an Israeli strike on Lebanese capital Beirut killed the top military commander for Hezbollah, Fu’ad Shukr.

message:

title: Hezbollah commander targeted by drone after missile barrage into Israel
message:
An Israel Air Force drone hit the motorcycle of Hezbollah Commander Hussein Ibrahim in the Tzur area in southern Lebanon on Saturday shortly after Hezbollah fired 55 rockets into northern Israel, the IDF confirmed.
Ibrahim was a commander in Hezbollah's Radwan Force - a force which has the main goal of infiltrating northern Israel.
The IDF confirmed on Saturday afternoon that shortly after sirens sounded in the area of Ayelet HaShahar in northern Israel, approximately 55 projectiles crossed from Lebanon.
Some of the barrages fell into open areas in northern Israel.
Hezbollah later said in a statement that it had struck the Ayelet Hashahar Kibbutz in northern Israel in retaliation for the Nabatieh strike.

title: 10 killed in Israeli airstrike in southern Lebanon - World News
message:
APTen people were killed and three displaced Syrians injured early Saturday in an Israeli airstrike on a residential building in southern Lebanon, according to official and military sources in Lebanon.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, told Xinhua that an Israeli warplane carried out a raid early Saturday, firing two air-to-ground missiles on the residential building in the middle of the industrial zone in Wadi al-Kfour, Nabatieh district, deep in southern Lebanon.
Military sources indicated that Israeli drones and warplanes launched four raids on four villages and towns in southern Lebanon at dawn and in the morning.
Meanwhile, Israeli artillery shelled eight villages and towns in the eastern, western and central sectors of the border area in southern Lebanon with 35 shells, causing material damage to a number of homes, sources said.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at the appropriate time and place.

title: Israeli attack on Gaza shelter kills 15 members of one Palestinian family
message:
Israeli strikes ‘wiping out whole families’ after attack on warehouse sheltering displaced Palestinians in az-Zawayda in central Gaza.
The Israeli military bombed a warehouse sheltering displaced Palestinians in the az-Zawayda area of central Gaza, killing 15 members of one family, including nine children.
The civil defence spokesman in Gaza, Mahmoud Basal, said on Saturday that 15 people killed in the overnight attack were members of the Ajlah family, with three women among the dead.
Reporting from Deir el-Balah in central Gaza, Al Jazeera’s Tareq Abu Azzoum said three Israeli missiles hit the warehouse, located a few kilometres south of the Nuseirat refugee camp.
On Saturday, Gaza’s Ministry of Health said Israeli attacks have killed 69 people and injured 136 in the last 48 hours.

Three Israeli missiles hit the warehouse about a mile from the Nuseirat refugee camp.

title: Deadly Israeli Airstrike Hits Residential Building in Lebanon
message:
An Israeli airstrike on a residential building in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, has killed around 10 people, including two children, and wounded five others, as reported by state news agency NNA on Saturday.
According to the Israeli military, the airstrike targeted a weapons depot used by Hezbollah militants.
The airstrike followed a pause in ceasefire talks between Palestinian Hamas and Israel in Doha.
The region has been on edge after a rocket strike blamed on Hezbollah killed 12 children and teens in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
Both Hezbollah and Iran have vowed to retaliate against Israel for recent events, including the killing of Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas's political chief, in Tehran.

title: Missile sparks blaze in Ukraine as Kyiv troops push into Russia Kursk region
message:
Russia is keeping up its assault on Ukraine even as Ukrainian forces push into Russia’s Kursk border regionRussia kept up its assault on Ukraine Saturday even as Ukrainian forces pushed into Russia’s Kursk border region.
Meanwhile, fighting continued in Russia’s Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops have been deployed since Aug. 6 in a bid to divert the Kremlin’s military focus away from the front line in Ukraine.
On Thursday, Ukrainian forces said they had seized the town of Sudzha, 10 kilometers (6 miles) from the border.
Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.
Ukrainian forces have also captured a number of Russian troops as they have moved across the region.

Meanwhile, fighting continued in Russia’s Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops have been deployed since Aug. 6 in a bid to divert the Kremlin’s military focus away from the front line in Ukraine.
Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.
Ukrainian forces have also captured a number of Russian troops as they have moved across the region.

title: Missile sparks blaze in Ukraine as Kyiv troops push into Russia Kursk region
message:
Moscow, Aug 17 (AP) A Russian missile strike sparked a blaze in the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Saturday, while Ukrainian forces continued to push into Russia's Kursk border region.
Meanwhile, fighting continued in Russia's Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops have been deployed since August 6 in a bid to divert the Kremlin's military focus away from the front line in Ukraine.
Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.
As many as 10,000 Ukrainian troops are involved, according to Western military analysts.
Ukrainian forces have also captured a number of Russian troops as they have moved across the region.

title: Russia says Ukraine used Western rockets to destroy bridge in Kursk region
message:
Russia says Ukraine used Western rockets to destroy bridge in Kursk regionreuters_tickers2 minutesMOSCOW (Reuters) -Russia’s foreign ministry said Ukraine had used Western rockets, likely U.S.-made HIMARS, to destroy a bridge over the Seym river in the Kursk region, killing volunteers trying to evacuate civilians.
“For the first time, the Kursk region was hit by Western-made rocket launchers, probably American HIMARS,” Maria Zakharova, spokeswoman for the Russian foreign ministry, said late on Friday on the Telegram messaging app.
Russia’s defence ministry, cited by the Interfax news agency, said on Saturday that Russian forces repelled several Ukrainian attacks in the Kursk region, but did not report recapturing any territory.
In a separate statement, the ministry accused Ukraine of planning to attack the plant in a false flag operation.
The U.S. HIMARS rockets provided to Ukraine have a range of up to about 80km (50 miles).

title: Filipinos advised to leave Lebanon immediately over war fear
message:
[Photo/Xinhua]MANILA -- Filipinos staying in Lebanon have been advised to leave the Middle East country as early as possible as tension escalates due to the threat of an all-out war between the Iran-backed group Hezbollah and Israel.
In a social media advisory Friday night, the Philippine Embassy in Lebanon urged Filipinos to leave when the airport remains operational.
To Filipinos who cannot leave Lebanon, the Embassy "strongly recommended" that they evacuate to safer areas outside capital Beirut, south of Lebanon, and the Bekaa Valley.
There are approximately 17,500 Filipinos staying in Lebanon, and around 3,000 are in southern Lebanon.
Alert level 3 or voluntary repatriation is issued "when violent disturbances or external aggression occur in a limited area."

title: Israeli Forces Claim To Have Destroyed 50 Hamas Tunnels Since Last Month
message:
1,200 people were killed in Hamas's attacks on Israel near the Gaza border on October 7 (File)During the past month, Israeli combat engineers have destroyed approximately 50 Hamas tunnel routes in the area of the Egypt-Gaza border, the Israel Defense Forces said on Thursday.
The tunnels were all in the Philadelphi corridor, a buffer zone that runs the length of the 14-km Gaza-Egypt border.
On August 4, soldiers from the IDF's elite Yahalom combat engineering unit destroyed a three-meter tall smuggling tunnel leading into Egypt that was large enough to drive vehicles through.
Securing the Philadelphi corridor and destroying smuggling tunnels there is a critical goal to prevent Hamas from rearming and to curtail its leaders from escaping into the Sinai with Israeli hostages.
Hamas has also been holding captive two Israeli civilians since 2014 and 2015, and the bodies of two soldiers killed in 2014.

title: Ismail Haniyeh son disputes how Hamas leader was killed
message:
Hamas head Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a guided missile that tracked his cell phone, his son Abdussalam Haniyeh told Saudi Arabia state media Al Arabiya Friday from Doha, Qatar, in an interview.
Haniyeh’s son told Al Arabiya that this was not the case.
“I think the story of an explosive device is completely baseless," he said.
"It was a guided missile that tracked his mobile phone that he had placed at night in his room near his head, which was directly hit," Haniyeh said to Al Arabiya.
Haniyeh concluded the interview by suggesting that he believes the airstrike was carried out with American "cover," Al Arabiya reported.

An Israeli airstrike kills 18 members of a family in Gaza as mediators hope for a cease-fireA Palestinian weeps at the funeral for more than 15 people, including four children and several women, killed in an Israeli strike, at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah, Gaza Strip, Saturday, Aug. 17, 2024.
(AP Photo/Abdel Kareem Hana)Original Publication Date August 17, 2024 - 3:06 AMDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people, all from the same family, on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
The Israeli military, which rarely comments on individual strikes, said it struck “terrorist infrastructure” in central Gaza where rockets had been fired toward Israel in recent weeks.
Around 110 are believed to be in Gaza, though Israeli authorities believe around a third are dead.

title: An Israeli airstrike kills 18 members of a family in Gaza as mediators hope for a cease - fire
message:
By WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDYDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people, all from the same family, on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas.
Officials from the United States, Egypt and Qatar ended two days of cease-fire talks and expressed hope that a deal could be reached in the 10-month-old war.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
The Israeli military, which rarely comments on individual strikes, said it struck “terrorist infrastructure” in central Gaza where rockets had been fired toward Israel in recent weeks.
Around 110 are believed to be in Gaza, though Israeli authorities believe around a third are dead.

title: A woman and her 2 children are among 10 killed in an Israeli strike in southern Lebanon
message:
(AP Photo/Mohammed Zaatari)BEIRUT – An Israeli strike in southern Lebanon early Saturday killed at least 10 Syrian nationals, according to Lebanon’s Health Ministry.
An Arabic-language spokesperson for the Israeli military, Avichay Adraee, said the strike in the southern province targeted a weapons depot belonging to Hezbollah.
Earlier Saturday, two Israeli soldiers were injured, one seriously, by a strike coming from Lebanon that hit the area of Misgav Am.
The Israeli military also said it had killed a Hezbollah commander Saturday in a separate strike in the area of the coastal city of Tyre.
Hours later, an explosion widely blamed on Israel killed Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in the Iranian capital.

title: Ukrainian Air Force Destroys Key Bridge in Russia Kursk Area – THISDAYLIVE
message:
The Ukrainian Air Force said it had destroyed a road bridge of strategic importance in Russia on Saturday, amid its offensive in the Kursk region.
Ukrainian Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk published a video on a Telegram channel showing the bombing of a bridge, in what experts say is likely to be genuine.
It had been shelled by Ukrainian forces for days during the incursion, which was launched on Aug. 6.
Oleshchuk confirmed that the Air Force is actively participating in the combat operations of the Ukrainian forces in the Kursk region.
“Thanks to the pilots and everyone who supports the Air Force’s fight,” Oleshchuk added.

title: Gaza war : 15 from same family killed in Israeli strike
message:
Photo: ReutersPublished: Sat 17 Aug 2024, 4:10 PMGaza's civil defence agency said an Israeli air strike in the early hours of Saturday killed 15 people from a Palestinian family, including nine children and three women.
The strike hit the home of the Ajlah family in Al Zawaida neighbourhood of central Gaza, civil defence spokesman Mahmud Bassal told AFP.
"The toll from the Israeli strike on the Ajlah family home and their warehouse in Al-Zawaida is 15 dead," Bassal said.
Bassal gave a list of those killed, including nine children and three women.
More than 10 months of war between Israel and Hamas has left vast swathes of Gaza in ruins.

title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills 10 , injures 5
message:
Around 10 people were killed, including two children, and five were wounded by an Israeli strike on a residential building in the city of Nabatieh City in south Lebanon, State news agency NNA said on Saturday (August 17, 2024).
The Israeli military said the airstrike targeted a weapons depot used by Hezbollah militants.
The strike came after ceasefire talks between Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and Israel in Doha paused on Friday (August 16, 2024) with negotiators due to meet again next week.
Tensions have soared in the region in recent weeks, after a rocket strike blamed on Hezbollah killed 12 children and teens in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
Hezbollah has vowed to retaliate against Israel, as has Iran for the killing in Tehran of the political chief of the Palestinian Hamas group, Ismail Haniyeh.

title: US court rules 26 / 11 Mumbai terror attacks accused Tahawwur Rana  extraditable to India  | Indiablooms
message:
Photo Courtesy:ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-SA 3.0)/Wikipedia CommonsAn American court has ruled that Pakistani-origin Canadian businessman Tahawwur Rana, whose name is involved in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, is “extraditable to India” under the extradition treaty between the two countries.
The panel affirmed the district court’s denial of Tahawwur Hussain Rana’s habeas corpus petition challenging a magistrate judge’s certification of Rana as extraditable to India for his alleged participation in terrorist attacks in Mumbai, reported ANI.
In its chargesheet, Mumbai Police had named Rana in connection with the attack that had left the nation shocked in 2008.
In the chargesheet, Rana is accused of supporting the 26/11 attacks’ mastermind David Coleman Headley, who conducted the recce of the Mumbai attacks, reported ANI.
The 2008 Mumbai attacks also referred to as 26/11 were a series of terrorist attacks that took place in November 2008, when 10 members of Lashkar-e-Taiba, an Islamic terrorist organisation based in Pakistan, carried out 12 coordinated shooting and bombing attacks lasting four days across Mumbai.

event_breakdown:
The Russian offensive in Ukraine has become the prime security event in Europe and across the world for many weeks, since the military invasion of Russia began on Jan 24, 2022. Peace talks have floundered, with new rounds scheduled to take place in Turkey on Feb 10. Western countries have placed heavy sanctions on Russia, including removing many Russian banks from the SWIFT banking system, and as of Feb 26 have banned all Russian aircraft from their airspace.
Yet the conflict is far from over, as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine grows more deadly and destructive each day. Here are the key events of the past few days, up to and including Feb 1st (current information):
1. Feb 28, 2022: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy accepted an offer of asylum from the leaders of “democratic countries”, including Poland and the Baltic nations. The United States and the UK have already begun evacuations of diplomatic staff from Ukraine, and encouraged US citizens to leave Ukraine as well via commercial flights still operating.
2. Feb 27, 2022: MASSIVE RUSSIAN ADVANCE ON KYIV. The capital was rocked by explosions, gunfire, and missile strikes, and flames could be seen from the Central railway station. Russian forces have already taken control of the Chernobyl nuclear power plant.
3. Feb 26, 2022: Putin has put his nuclear forces on high alert, suggesting Russia may escalate the invasion to nuclear war.
4. Feb 25, 2022: Kharkiv was struck by missile fire.

Meanwhile, fighting continued in Russia’s Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops have been deployed since August 6 in a bid to divert the Kremlin’s military focus away from the front line in Ukraine.
Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.
As many as 10,000 Ukrainian troops are involved, according to Western military analysts.
Destroyed Russian tanks lie on a roadside near Sudzha, in the Kursk region (AP Photo)“No one expected that this kind of conflict was even possible in the Kursk region.
Ukrainian forces have also captured a number of Russian troops as they have moved across the region.
event_breakdown:
Reported events that can be placed on a map:

1. On August 17, 2022, Russian troops began a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, targeting major cities and military installations in the country. The invasion began with airstrikes on Ukrainian military bases and key infrastructure, followed by a multi-pronged ground invasion led by Russian forces. Russian troops are currently concentrated around the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, where they have faced fierce resistance from Ukrainian forces.
2. Meanwhile, fighting continued in Russia’s Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops have been deployed since August 6, 2022 in a bid to divert the Kremlin's military focus away from the front line in Ukraine. Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.

event_breakdown:
New event reported on June 30, 2022
Ukraine has launched a military operation to evacuate civilians trapped in the Kursk region, where fighting has been ongoing with Russia since August 6. As many as 10,000 Ukrainian troops are involved, according to Western military analysts.

title: Russian forces have stormed Pokrovsk front 25 times since Saturday began – Ukraine General Staff
message:
Ukrainian and Russian forces have clashed 72 times since the beginning of the day.
Source: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook, information as of 16:00 on 17 AugustDetails: On the Kharkiv front, Russian forces stormed the positions of Ukrainian troops four times near the settlements of Vovchansk and Lyptsi.
Ukrainian defenders repelled Russian attacks near the villages of Berestove and Lozova.
On the Lyman front, Russian forces are continuing their attacks near the settlements of Makiivka, Nevske, Hrekivka, Novoiehorivka and Dibrova.
Ukraine's defence forces have repelled 25 Russian attacks, and 11 engagements are still in progress.
event_breakdown: Russian forces storming the positions of the Ukrainian troops on the Kharkiv front near the settlements of Vovchansk and Lyptsi

title: Ukrainian Valkyries : Women embrace military training to learn to defend their homeland ( Photos )
message:
Photojournalist Oksana Parafeniuk went to several all-female training courses to observe the participants' experiences and learn about their motivation.
Anna Syvohip, 24, who works in IT business development, poses for a portrait during military training in Kyiv, Ukraine on July 6, 2024.
(Oksana Parafeniuk / The Kyiv Independent)Viktoriia Holovko, 22, a clothing stylist from Poltava Oblast, lived and studied in Kharkiv.
(Oksana Parafeniuk / The Kyiv Independent)Participants of the all-female training in firearms practice operating AK-47 during the training in Kyiv, Ukraine on July 6, 2024.
(Oksana Parafeniuk / The Kyiv Independent)Weapons lie on the ground during the all-female training in firearms in Kyiv, Ukraine, on July 6, 2024.
event_breakdown:
Title: Women and firearms in Kyiv
Location: Kyiv, Ukraine
Date: 2024-07-06

Participants of all-female training in Kyiv, Ukraine can practice with AK-47 on July 6, 2024. Anna Syvohip, 24, works in IT business development. Viktoriia Holovko, 22, a clothing stylist, lived and studied previously in Kharkiv.

title: RMT seeks to rein in strike action by Royal Fleet Auxiliary seafarers to aid Labour government war agenda
message:
The RMT leader is acting to rein in his members based on support for the Labour government’s war agenda.
This is based on a transactional agreement to support war.
The RMT represents 500 members at the RFA from deckhands, engine, communications, catering staff and security staff.
The first day of strike action was used by Nautilus to warn the Labour government it was sitting on wider opposition.
Lynch in a July 11 update to members at RFA members described meeting with the MOD and new Armed Forces Minister Luke Pollard MP, as a breath of fresh air.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map:

* The RMT represents 500 members at the RFA from deckhands, engine, communications, catering staff, and security staff.
* The first day of strike action was used by Nautilus to warn the Labour government it was sitting on wider opposition.
* Lynch in a July 11 update to members at RFA members described meeting with the MOD and new Armed Forces Minister Luke Pollard MP, as a breath of fresh air.

title: Book shares the love letters of Richard Nixon and Pat Nixon
message:
Outside Rose Hills Memorial Park, in Whittier, where the funeral was held in January 1926, Thelma’s friends stood waiting.
She and her brothers graduated from the school as a trio in 1937, the same year Pat moved to Whittier.
There, in the winter of 1938, assuming bit parts in stage dramas put on by the Whittier Community Players, she met a lawyer with a theatrical sense of his own: Richard Nixon, who immediately declared “I’d like to have a date with you,” engendering Pat’s cool reply, “Oh, I’m too busy.”6 Then-Vice President Richard Nixon arrives in Chicago with Pat Nixon in July, 1960.
AP6 First Lady Pat Nixon shakes hands with a wounded soldier while touring Saigon in July 1969, the first visit by the wife of a sitting president to an active combat zone.
6 Richard and Pat Nixon on a visit to Ghana in 1958.
event_breakdown: The news of Thelma Catherine's funeral at Rose Hills Memorial Park in Whittier and Richard Nixon's theatrical sense of his own is not related to security events and therefore will not be placed on the map. However, the mention of Pat Nixon, First Lady Pat Nixon and President Nixon's trip to Vietnam, Iraq, Ghana and other countries is an event that can be placed on a map. The First Lady Pat Nixon's first visit by the wife of a sitting president to an active combat zone in Saigon, Vietnam is an important security event in American history.
